001package pkg_class;
002
003//import javax.swing.*;
004import javax.swing.JFrame;
005import javax.swing.JTextField;
006import javax.swing.JTextArea;
007import javax.swing.JLabel;
008import javax.swing.ImageIcon;
009import javax.swing.JPanel;
010import javax.swing.JScrollPane;
011import javax.swing.JButton;
012import java.io.InputStream;
013
014//import java.awt.Image;
015//import java.awt.Graphics;
016//import java.awt.Frame;
017//import java.awt.Graphics2D;
018//import java.awt.GradientPaint;
019//import java.awt.*;
020import java.awt.Dimension;
021import java.awt.BorderLayout;
022import java.awt.Color;
023import java.awt.Font;
024//import java.awt.Toolkit;
025//import java.awt.event.*;
026import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
027import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
028import java.awt.event.WindowAdapter;
029import java.awt.event.WindowEvent;
030import java.net.URL;
031import javax.imageio.ImageIO;
032
033import java.util.List;
034/**
035 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
036 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
037 * 
038 * This class implements a simple graphical user interface with a text entry
039 * area, a text output area, an image and a button.
040 * 
041 * @author Michael Kolling + Elie DUBOUX
042 * @version 2003.01 + 2019 + 2021.01
043 * @see GameEngine
044 */
045public class UserInterface implements ActionListener
046{
047    /**
048     * The game engine.
049     */
050    private GameEngine aEngine;
051    /**
052     * The game Model
053     */
054    private GameModel aGameModel;
055    /**
056     * The frame.
057     */
058    private JFrame     aMyFrame;
059    /**
060     * The entry field.
061     */
062    private JTextField aEntryField;
063    /**
064     * The text field.
065     */
066    private JTextArea  aLog;
067    /**
068     * The image for the room.
069     */
070    private JLabel     aImage;
071    /**
072     * The button look.
073     */
074    private JButton    aButtonIntentory;
075    /**
076     * The image for the background.
077     */
078    //private JLabel aImageBackground;
079    /**
080     * Construct a UserInterface. As a parameter, a Game Engine
081     * (an object processing and executing the game commands) is
082     * needed.
083     * 
084     * @param pGameEngine The GameEngine object implementing the game logic.
085     * @param pGameModel The GameModel.
086     */
087    public UserInterface(final GameEngine pGameEngine, final GameModel pGameModel)
088    {
089        this.aEngine = pGameEngine;
090        this.aGameModel = pGameModel;
091        this.createGUI();
092    } // UserInterface()
093
094    /**
095     * Print out some text into the text area.
096     * @param pText The text to print.
097     */
098    public void print(final String pText)
099    {
100        this.aLog.append(pText);
101        this.aLog.setCaretPosition(this.aLog.getDocument().getLength());
102    } // print()
103
104    /**
105     * Print out some text into the text area, followed by a line break.
106     * @param pText The text to print.
107     */
108    public void println(final String pText)
109    {
110        this.print(pText + "\n");
111    } // println()
112
113    /**
114     * Show an image file in the interface.
115     * @param pImageName The path and the name of the image.
116     */
117    public void showImage(final String pImageName)
118    {
119        String vImagePath = "\\images\\" + pImageName; // to change the directory
120        InputStream vImageIN = UserInterface.class.getResourceAsStream(vImagePath);
121        if (vImageIN == null)
122            this.println("Image not found : " + vImagePath);
123        else
124        {
125            try
126            {
127                ImageIcon vIcon = new ImageIcon(ImageIO.read(vImageIN));
128                this.aImage.setIcon(vIcon);
129                this.aMyFrame.pack();
130            }
131            catch(Exception e)
132            {
133                this.println(e.toString());
134                //this.println("Error for " + vImagePath);
135            }
136        }
137    }//showImage()
138
139    /**
140     * Enable or disable input in the input field.
141     * @param pOnOff True when you can write on the entry field,
142     * false otherwise.
143     */
144    public void enable(final boolean pOnOff)
145    {
146        this.aEntryField.setEditable(pOnOff); // enable/disable
147        this.aButtonIntentory.setEnabled(pOnOff);
148        if (! pOnOff) 
149        { // disable
150            // cursor won't blink
151            this.aEntryField.getCaret().setBlinkRate(0);
152            // won't react to entry
153            this.aEntryField.removeActionListener(this);
154            this.aButtonIntentory.removeActionListener(this); 
155        }
156    }//enable()
157
158    /**
159     * Set up graphical user interface.
160     */
161    private void createGUI()
162    {
163        this.aMyFrame = new JFrame("RPandaScape");
164        this.aEntryField = new JTextField(34);
165        this.aLog = new JTextArea();
166        // {  
167             // public void paintComponent(Graphics g) 
168             // {  
169                  // Graphics2D comp2D = (Graphics2D)g;
170                  // comp2D.setColor(Color.blue);
171                  
172                  // GradientPaint pat = new GradientPaint(0f, 0f, Color.white,100f,45f,Color.blue);
173                  // comp2D.setPaint(pat);
174             // }  
175        // };
176        this.aLog.setFont(new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 12));
177        this.aLog.setEditable(false);
178        this.aButtonIntentory = new JButton("inventory");
179        
180        //this.aLog.setOpaque(false);
181        //(0,206,209) blue 
182        this.aEntryField.setBackground(new Color(255,239,213));
183        this.aLog.setBackground(new Color(255,239,213));
184        JScrollPane vListScroller = new JScrollPane(this.aLog);
185        vListScroller.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(200, 200));
186        vListScroller.setMinimumSize(new Dimension(100,100));
187
188        JPanel vPanel = new JPanel();
189        this.aImage = new JLabel();
190        vPanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout()); // ==> only five places
191        vPanel.add(this.aImage, BorderLayout.NORTH);
192        vPanel.add(vListScroller, BorderLayout.CENTER);
193        vPanel.add(this.aEntryField, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
194        vPanel.add(this.aButtonIntentory , BorderLayout.EAST);
195        
196        // JPanel contentPane = new JPanel() 
197        // {  
198             // public void paintComponent(Graphics g) 
199             // {  
200                  // Image img = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("images/background.jpg");  
201                  // g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, this.getWidth(), this.getHeight(), this);  
202             // }  
203        // };
204        
205        // contentPane.setLayout(new BorderLayout());
206        // //contentPane.setOpaque(false);
207        // vPanel.add(contentPane);
208        // this.aMyFrame.setContentPane(contentPane);
209        
210        this.aMyFrame.getContentPane().add(vPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
211        
212        // add some event listeners to some components
213        this.aEntryField.addActionListener(this);
214        this.aButtonIntentory.addActionListener(this);
215        
216        // to end program when window is closed
217        this.aMyFrame.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter() 
218        {
219            public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) { System.exit(0); }
220        });
221        
222        
223        this.aMyFrame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(600, 800));
224        this.aMyFrame.pack();
225        this.aMyFrame.setVisible(true);
226        this.aEntryField.requestFocus();
227    }//createGUI()
228
229    /**
230     * Actionlistener interface for entry textfield.
231     * @param pEvent The event when a button is clicked.
232     */
233    public void actionPerformed(final ActionEvent pEvent) 
234    {
235        if (pEvent.getSource() == this.aButtonIntentory)
236            this.aEngine.interpretCommand("inventory");
237            
238        if (pEvent.getSource() == this.aEntryField)
239            this.processCommand();
240    }//actionPerformed(.)
241
242    /**
243     * A command has been entered. Read the command and do whatever is 
244     * necessary to process it.
245     */
246    private void processCommand()
247    {
248        String vInput = this.aEntryField.getText();
249        this.aEntryField.setText("");
250
251        this.aEngine.interpretCommand(vInput);
252    }//processCommand()
253    
254    /**
255     * A command has been entered. Read the command and do whatever is 
256     * necessary to process it.
257     * Used in the test.
258     * @param pInput A line in a test file.
259     */
260    public void processCommand(final String pInput)
261    {
262        this.aEngine.interpretCommand(pInput);
263    }//processCommand()
264    
265    /**
266     * Print the room description and change the image.
267     */
268    public void printLocationInfo()
269    {
270        if (this.aGameModel.getPlayer().getCurrentRoom().getImage() != null)
271            this.showImage(this.aGameModel.getPlayer().getCurrentRoom().getImage());
272        this.println(this.aGameModel.getLocationInfo());
273    }//printLocationInfo()
274    
275    /**
276     * Print the welcome menu and information about the room where the 
277     * player spawn.
278     */
279    public void printWelcome()
280    {
281        this.println(this.aGameModel.getWelcomeString());
282        this.printLocationInfo();
283    }//printWelcome()
284    
285    /**
286     * Method called when the player ask for help.
287     */
288    public void printHelp()
289    {
290        this.println(this.aGameModel.getHelpString());
291    }//printHelp()
292    
293    /**
294     * Methode called when the player can have access to the final speech,
295     * and when he talk again with the traveller.
296     */
297    public void printAdviceFinalSpeech()
298    {
299        this.println(this.aGameModel.getAdviceFinalSpeech());
300    }
301    
302    /**
303     * Method called when the player quit the game.
304     */
305    public void goodBye() 
306    {
307        this.println(this.aGameModel.getGoodByeString());
308        this.enable(false);
309    }//printGoodBye()
310    
311    /**
312     * Method called when the player lose the game.
313     */
314    public void gameOver()
315    {
316        this.println(this.aGameModel.getGameOver());
317        this.enable(false);
318    }//gameOver()
319    
320    /**
321     * Method called when the player has won the game.
322     */
323    public void gameWon()
324    {
325        this.println(this.aGameModel.getVictory());
326        this.showImage("victory.jpg");
327        this.enable(false);
328    }
329    
330    /**
331     * Return the rooms of the game. They are given by the Game Model.
332     * Used in the AleaCommand
333     * @return The rooms.
334     */
335    public List<Room> getRooms()
336    {
337        return this.aGameModel.getRooms();
338    }//getRooms()
339    
340    /**
341     * Return the player in the gameModel.
342     * Used in some commands.
343     * @return The player.
344     */
345    public Player getPlayer()
346    {
347        return this.aGameModel.getPlayer();
348    }//getPlayer
349}//UserInterface
